meanings.definition: Extremely relaxed or informal in style or manner.
meanings.sent1: She wore an ultracasual outfit to the picnic, with flip-flops and a loose t-shirt.
meanings.sent2: The beach party had an ultracasual vibe, with everyone lounging in the sand.
meanings.sent3: His ultracasual attitude towards deadlines sometimes got him into trouble at work.
meanings.sent4: The ultracasual atmosphere of the small cafe made it a favorite spot for locals.
meanings.sent5: The ultracasual dress code of the event allowed guests to feel comfortable and at ease.

meanings.definition: A person who is very laid-back or unconcerned about appearances or rules.
meanings.sent1: As an ultracasual, he never stressed about what others thought of him.
meanings.sent2: The ultracasual strolled into the meeting late, unfazed by the stares.
meanings.sent3: The ultracasual's nonchalant response to the dress code violation left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the ultracasual of the group, always going with the flow.
meanings.sent5: The ultracasual's carefree attitude was both refreshing and contagious.
